description.short: Path to a directory. Can be used to query file and directory contents.
description.full:
ofDirectory is a class for reading and manipulating directories on the file system through openFrameworks.

Here is a common way to use it:

//some path, may be absolute or relative to bin/data
string path = "/my/path/file"; 
ofDirectory dir(path);
//only show png files
dir.allowExt("png");
//populate the directory object
dir.listDir();

//go through and print out all the paths
for(int i = 0; i < dir.size(); i++){
	ofLogNotice(dir.getPath(i));
}

methods.name: allowExt
methods.parameters: const string &extension
methods.short:
Allow a file extension when listing the contents the current directory path.

Setting an allowed extension enables a whitelist mode which only lists extensions which have been explicitly allowed.

Parameters:

extension file type extension ie. "jpg", "png", "txt", etc
methods.desc:
Adds an allowed extension to the list of filters when listing directories. Use this to set any number of filters before calling listDir().

For example if you wanted to only get images in a directory, you may set several filters:

string path = "/path/to/images";
ofDirectory dir(path);
dir.allowExt("png");
dir.allowExt("jpg");
dir.allowExt("gif");
dir.listDir();

methods.name: canExecute
methods.short:
Check if the current path is executable.

Returns: true if executable
methods.desc: Returns true if the current directory is executable. An executable directory can be entered into with command such as cd.

methods.name: canRead
methods.short:
Check if the current path is readable.

Returns: true if readable
methods.desc: Returns true if the open directory can be read.

methods.name: canWrite
methods.short:
Check if the current path is writeable.

Returns: true if writable
methods.desc: Returns true if the open directory can be written to.

methods.name: close
methods.short: Close the currently open path.
methods.desc: Closes the directory.

methods.name: copyTo
methods.parameters: const filesystem::path &path, bool bRelativeToData=true, bool overwrite=false
methods.short:
Copy the current file or directory path to a new path.

Copies relative to the data path & does not overwrite by default does not change the current path & assumes the new path is in the data directory.

Parameters:

path destination file or directory path

bRelativeToData set to false if you are working with paths that are not in the data directory

overwrite set to true if you want to overwrite the file or directory at the new path

Returns: true if the copy was successful
methods.desc: Copies the directory into path. If bRelativeToData is set to false then path should be absolute. If overwrite is set to true any existing files with the same name will be overwritten by the copy.

methods.name: create
methods.parameters: bool recursive=false
methods.short:
Create a directory at the current path.

Parameters:

bRecursive set to true to automatically create nested directories as required
methods.desc:
Creates the directory if it doesn't exist already. A common reason to use create is to ensure that you are able to write files to a known path, like so

string path = "/path/to/file";
ofDirectory dir(path);
if(!dir.exists()){
	dir.create(true);
}
//now you can be sure that path exists

The recursive boolean flag will indicate if you'd like to create directories all the directories required to reach the given path. In our example, if "/path/to" didn't already exist, the call to create() would also create these. If recursive were set to false, the directory would not be created.

methods.name: createDirectory
methods.parameters: const filesystem::path &dirPath, bool bRelativeToData=true, bool recursive=false
methods.short:
Create a directory at a given path.

Creates relative to the data path by default.

Parameters:

dirPath directory path

bRelativeToData set to false if you are working with paths that are not in the data directory

bRecursive set to true to automatically create nested directories as required

Returns: true if directory was created successfully
methods.desc: Static method to create a directory at a given path.

methods.name: doesDirectoryExist
methods.parameters: const filesystem::path &dirPath, bool bRelativeToData=true
methods.short:
Check if a directory exists at a given path.

Assumes directory path is relative to the data path by default.

Parameters:

dirPath directory path

bRelativeToData set to false if you are working with paths that are not in the data directory

Returns: true if the directory exists
methods.desc: Returns true if the directory at dirPath exists.

methods.name: exists
methods.short:
Check if a directory exists at the current path.

Returns: true if exists
methods.desc: Returns true if the open directory exists. Great to be used in conjunction with ofDirectory::create()

methods.name: getFile
methods.parameters: size_t position, ofFile::Mode mode=Reference, bool binary=true

methods.short:
Get files and directories in the directory contents list.

Directory contents are automatically listed.

Returns: vector of files in the directory
methods.desc: Returns a vector of ofFile objects populated by a prior call to listDir(). The files are opened in ofFile::Reference mode.

methods.name: getName
methods.parameters: size_t position
methods.desc: Returns the file name,(eg "mypicture.png") with extension but not the enclosing path at a given index. Position must be less than the result of numFiles().

methods.name: getOriginalDirectory
methods.short: Returns: the current path

methods.name: getPath
methods.parameters: size_t position
methods.desc: Returns the absolute path,(eg "/path/to/files/mypicture.png"). Position must be less than the result of size().

methods.name: getShowHidden
methods.desc: Returns if hidden files are set to be shown or not.

methods.name: getSorted
methods.short:
Get a sorted ofDirectory instance using the current path.

Returns: sorted ofDirectory instance

methods.name: isDirectory
methods.short:
Check if the current path is indeed a directory and not a file.

Returns: true if a directory
methods.desc: Returns true if the given path is actually a directory.

methods.name: isDirectoryEmpty
methods.parameters: const filesystem::path &dirPath, bool bRelativeToData=true
methods.short:
Check if a directory at a given path is empty.

Assumes directory path is relative to the data path by default.

Parameters:

dirPath directory path

bRelativeToData set to false if you are working with paths that are not in the data directory

Returns: true if the directory is empty aka contains no files or directories
methods.desc: Returns true if the directory at dirPath is empty.

methods.name: isHidden
methods.desc: Returns true if the directory is hidden in the file system.

methods.name: listDir
methods.parameters: const string &path
methods.short:
Open and read the contents of a directory.

Uses allowed extension whitelist to ignore unwanted file types if allowExt() has been called.

Parameters:

path directory path

Returns: number of paths found
methods.desc: Opens and populates the directory with files. Returns the number of files found.

methods.name: listDir
methods.short:
Open and read the contents of the current directory.

Uses allowed extension whitelist to ignore unwanted file types if allowExt() has been called.

Returns: number of paths found
methods.desc: Populates the directory with files. Call this after opening a directory and setting filters. After this call, size(), getPath(position), and getName(position) can be used to access the contents of the directory.

methods.name: moveTo
methods.parameters: const filesystem::path &path, bool bRelativeToData=true, bool overwrite=false
methods.short:
Move the current file or directory path to a new path.

Moves relative to the data path & does not overwrite by default does not change the current path & assumes the new path is in the data directory.

Parameters:

path destination file or directory path

bRelativeToData set to false if you are working with paths that are not in the data directory

overwrite set to true if you want to overwrite the file or directory at the new path

Returns: true if the copy was successful
methods.desc: Moves the directory into another directory at path. If bRelativeToData is set to false then path should be absolute. If overwrite is set to true any existing files with the same name will be overwritten by the move.

methods.name: ofDirectory
methods.parameters: const filesystem::path &path
methods.short:
Create an ofDirectory instance and attempt to open the path.

Parameters:

path directory path
methods.desc: Constructs a directory object and calls open() on the provided path. The contents of the path are not accessible until listDir() is called.

methods.name: ofDirectory
methods.short:
Create an ofDirectory instance

Does not refer to a specific directory until you either open or create a directory path.
methods.desc: Constructs an empty directory object.

methods.name: open
methods.parameters: const filesystem::path &path
methods.short:
Open a directory path, clears the current file list.

Parameters:

path directory path
methods.desc: Opens a path. At this point you can see if the directory exists by calling exists() but the contents of the path are not accessible until listDir() is called.

methods.name: openFromCWD
methods.parameters: const filesystem::path &path
methods.short:
Open a directory path relative to the current working directory without calling ofToDataPath internally, clears the current file list.

Parameters:

path directory path

methods.name: operator!=
methods.parameters: const ofDirectory &dir
methods.desc: Returns true if this directory and another have different paths.

methods.name: operator<
methods.parameters: const ofDirectory &dir
methods.desc: Returns true if the right hand side directory is alphabetically after the left hand side directory.

methods.name: operator<=
methods.parameters: const ofDirectory &dir
methods.desc: Returns true if the right hand side directory is alphabetically after or equal to the left hand side directory.

methods.name: operator==
methods.parameters: const ofDirectory &dir
methods.desc: Returns true if this directory and another have the same path.
Returns true if the left hand side directory is alphabetically after the right hand side directory.
Returns true if the left hand side directory is alphabetically after or equal to the right hand side directory;

methods.name: operator[]
methods.parameters: size_t position
methods.desc: Operator for accessing files with array notation syntax. Call is equivalent to ofFile::getFile(position).

methods.name: path
methods.short:
Get the current path.

Returns: current path
methods.desc: Returns the currently opened path.

methods.name: remove
methods.parameters: bool recursive
methods.short:
Removes the file or directory at the current path.

Does not remove non-empty directories by default.

Warning: Be careful! This deletes a file or folder. :)

Parameters:

recursive set to true to remove a non-empty directory and its contents

Returns: true if the path was removed successfully
methods.desc: Deletes the directory. If recursive is set to false and this directory contains others the remove will fail.

methods.name: removeDirectory
methods.parameters: const filesystem::path &path, bool deleteIfNotEmpty, bool bRelativeToData=true
methods.short:
remove a directory at a given path

Parameters:

deleteIfNotEmpty set to true if you want to recursively delete the directory and its contents

bRelativeToData set to false if you are working with paths that are not in the data directory

Returns: true if the path was removed successfully
methods.desc: Removes a directory. If deleteIfNotEmpty is set to false and the directory contains files the call will fail.

methods.name: renameTo
methods.parameters: const filesystem::path &path, bool bRelativeToData=true, bool overwrite=false
methods.short:
Rename the current file or directory path to a new path.

Renames relative to the data path & does not overwrite by default does not change the current path & assumes the new path is in the data directory.

Parameters:

path destination file or directory path

bRelativeToData set to false if you are working with paths that are not in the data folder

overwrite set to true if you want to overwrite the file or directory at the new path

Returns: true if the copy was successful
methods.desc: Renames the directory to the path path. If bRelativeToData is set to false then path should be absolute. If overwrite is set to true any existing files with the same name will be overwritten by the rename.

methods.name: reset
methods.short:
Closes the directory.

This is for backwards compatibility with ofxDirList.
methods.desc: Resets the current directory. Equivalent to close().

methods.name: setExecutable
methods.parameters: bool executable=true
methods.short:
Set the executable flag of the current path.

Parameters:

executable set to true to make path executable
methods.desc: Enables or disables execution on the current open directory. If the directory is executable then it can be entered through commands such as cd.

methods.name: setReadable
methods.parameters: bool readable=true
methods.short:
Set the readable flag of the current path.

Parameters:

readable set to true to make path readable

methods.name: setShowHidden
methods.parameters: bool showHidden
methods.desc: Sets whether or not the call to listDir() will return hidden files.

methods.name: setWriteable
methods.parameters: bool writeable=true
methods.short:
Set the writable flag of the current path.

Parameters:

writable set to true to make path writable
methods.desc: Enables or disables writeable on the current open directory.

methods.name: size
methods.short:
Get the number of paths in the current directory list.

Warning: Call listDir() before using this function or it will return 0 since the directory list will be empty.

Returns: number of paths
methods.desc: Returns the number of files contained within the directory. Set after listDir() is called.

methods.name: sort
methods.short:
Sort the directory contents list alphabetically.

Warning: Call listDir() before using this function or there will be nothing to sort.
methods.desc: Sorts the contents of the directory by filename.

methods.name: sortByDate
methods.short:
Sort the directory contents list by date.

Warning: Call listDir() before using this function or there will be nothing to sort.

##InlineDescription

Path to a directory. Can be used to query file and directory contents.

##Description

ofDirectory is a class for reading and manipulating directories on the file system through openFrameworks.

Here is a common way to use it:

//some path, may be absolute or relative to bin/data
string path = "/my/path/file"; 
ofDirectory dir(path);
//only show png files
dir.allowExt("png");
//populate the directory object
dir.listDir();

//go through and print out all the paths
for(int i = 0; i < dir.size(); i++){
	ofLogNotice(dir.getPath(i));
}

page.raw:
#class ofDirectory


<!--
_visible: True_
_advanced: False_
_istemplated: False_
_extends: _
-->

##InlineDescription



Path to a directory. Can be used to query file and directory
contents.






##Description

ofDirectory is a class for reading and manipulating directories on the file system through openFrameworks.

Here is a common way to use it:

~~~~{.cpp}
//some path, may be absolute or relative to bin/data
string path = "/my/path/file"; 
ofDirectory dir(path);
//only show png files
dir.allowExt("png");
//populate the directory object
dir.listDir();

//go through and print out all the paths
for(int i = 0; i < dir.size(); i++){
	ofLogNotice(dir.getPath(i));
}
~~~~

<!--

_summary: _
_constant: False_

_visible: True_

_inlined_description: _

Allow a file extension when listing the contents the current
directory path.

Setting an allowed extension enables a whitelist mode which only lists
extensions which have been explicitly allowed.


**Parameters:**

extension file type extension ie. "jpg", "png", "txt", etc





_description: _

Adds an allowed extension to the list of filters when listing directories. Use this to set any number of filters before calling listDir().

For example if you wanted to only get images in a directory, you may set several filters:

~~~~{.cpp}
string path = "/path/to/images";
ofDirectory dir(path);
dir.allowExt("png");
dir.allowExt("jpg");
dir.allowExt("gif");
dir.listDir();
~~~~

###bool create(recursive = false)

<!--
_syntax: create(recursive = false)_
_name: create_
_returns: bool_
_returns_description: _
_parameters: bool recursive=false_
_access: public_
_version_started: 007_
_version_deprecated: _
_summary: _
_constant: False_
_static: False_
_visible: True_
_advanced: False_
-->

_inlined_description: _

Create a directory at the current path.


**Parameters:**

bRecursive set to true to automatically create nested directories
as required





_description: _

Creates the directory if it doesn't exist already. A common reason to use create is to ensure that you are able to write files to a known path, like so

~~~~{.cpp}
string path = "/path/to/file";
ofDirectory dir(path);
if(!dir.exists()){
	dir.create(true);
}
//now you can be sure that path exists
~~~~

The recursive boolean flag will indicate if you'd like to create directories all the directories required to reach the given path.  In our example, if "/path/to" didn't already exist, the call to create() would also create these. If recursive were set to false, the directory would not be created.
